title: Tonkatsu with Cabbage
description: Crisp, golden-brown breaded pork cutlets served with a mound of finely shredded cabbage and tangy tonkatsu sauce. This Japanese comfort classic balances crunchy panko coating, juicy pork, and bright, refreshing cabbage for contrast.

ingredients.display_name: pork loin chops, boneless, trimmed to 1/2-inch thickness
ingredients.notes: about 170 g (6 oz) each; if thick, butterfly to 1/2 inch then pound gently
neutral oil with high smoke point; amount for shallow-deep frying in skillet
about 600 g; core removed and thinly sliced
see notes for homemade sauce ingredients
for homemade: 1/2 cup ketchup, 2 tbsp Worcestershire or diluted soy, 1 tbsp sugar, 1 tsp Dijon mustard, 1 tbsp mirin or rice vinegar - combine and simmer briefly

steps.text: Prepare pork: pat each chop dry, trim excess fat, butterfly or pound to even 1/2-inch thickness using plastic wrap to protect meat; season both sides lightly with salt and pepper.

Set up breading station in three shallow dishes: one with flour, one with beaten eggs, one with panko breadcrumbs; season flour lightly if desired. Coat each pork piece first in flour (shake off excess), then egg, then press into panko to fully cover.

Heat oil in a wide skillet to 170–180°C (340–360°F) for shallow-deep frying; oil depth should be about 1/2–1 inch (12–25 mm) so cutlets can fry evenly. If you don't have a thermometer, test with a small breadcrumb—it should sizzle steadily without burning.

Fry cutlets in batches without crowding: add cutlet to hot oil and fry until golden brown on first side, about 3–4 minutes, then flip and cook 3–4 minutes on the other side until internal temperature reaches 63°C (145°F). Transfer to a wire rack set over a sheet pan to rest and drain.

While frying, prepare cabbage: core and finely shred the cabbage, then rinse and spin or pat dry. Toss lightly with a small pinch of salt and optional tablespoon of neutral oil or a splash of rice vinegar to keep it crisp and bright.
Warm tonkatsu sauce if desired or whisk homemade components together; check seasoning and adjust sweetness or acidity. Slice rested cutlets into 1/2-inch strips using a sharp knife.

Plate: mound shredded cabbage, arrange sliced tonkatsu alongside, drizzle or serve tonkatsu sauce on the cutlets, and add lemon wedges for optional brightness. Serve immediately while cutlets are hot and crispy.
